entries.meaning: Quick and light in movement or action.
examples: He was too nimble for the assailant and easily escaped his grasp.
She has a nimble mind and can improvise in any situation.

verbs.description: nimble (third-person singular simple present nimbles, present participle nimbling, simple past and past participle nimbled)
